EMODAnalyzeR 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Reference

    All functions

    calculate.DALY()

    Calculate the DALY population run on EMOD. DALY stands for Disability Adjusted Life Years. It is a measure of years lost due to a disease - in this case, HIV. It is adjusted for the disability of living with the disease. By default, living with untreated HIV has a weight of 0.3 (or a year with HIV is worth 70 a weight of 0.1. We also discount future years of DALY. By default, each future year is discounted a compounding 3 by the 10th year, we the DALY will be multiplied by 0.97^10.

    calculate.bounds.effective_count()

    Calculate the 95 percent confidence interval of an estimate given effective counts. This is used to calculate confidence intervals from EMOD calibration data that comes from a Beta distribution

    calculate.bounds.two_sigma()

    Calculate the 95 percent confidence interval of an estimate given 2 sigma. This is used to calculate confidence intervals from EMOD calibration data that comes from a Gaussian distribution

    calculate.incidence()

    Calculate incidence of an EMOD simulation

    calculate.pop_scaling_factor()

    Calculate the scaling factor for a population run on EMOD. Typically when we run EMOD, we scale down our population for the sake of computation costs. In order to get correct counts of different statuses (i.e., number of people who died from HIV), we need to scale our data. This function will not scale the data, rather it will add a scaling-factor column to the data that you can multiply any column of interest by.

    calculate.tests.performed()

    Calculate number of tests performed in an EMOD simulation

    emodplot.age_prevalence()

    Plot age-prevalence curves, stratified by year and gender

    emodplot.prevalence()

    Plot prevalence of hiv stratified by gender

    emodplot.by_gender()

    Plot by gender

    read.simulation.results()

    Read results of an EMOD simulation

    read.simulation.results.bigpurple()

    Read results of an EMOD simulation from its original location off the BigPurple filesystem

    report.calibration.results()

    Report calibration fit of EMOD simulation
